fr_reason: The first patent (US20210259560A1) aims to continuously monitor a subject's physiological state over an extended period, while the second patent (KR102407094B1) focuses specifically on measuring blood pressure. The second patent reduces equipment size, eliminates cuff-related damage, potentially improves accuracy compared to existing cuffless methods, and increases portability, but it does not have the same broad strategic value as the first patent.
